moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 Nd7 3. Nf3 f6: Not recommended unless you know it very well. It opens the BK to attacks by the Q on h5, if supported by Nxg6.
moves.4. Nbd2 e6 5. e4: Opening the diag for the Q.
moves.7. Nh4: Inviting to fork the two pieces.
moves.7... Nd5: Black thinks he's smart, and plans to exchange the Rh8 for two pieces, with a great risk of having my Q trapped.
moves.8. Qh5+: Accepting the challenge, but of course, I'm not going for the previous line.
moves.8... g6 9. Nxg6 hxg6: If now QxR, NxB, and white loses.
moves.10. Qxg6+: But this saves my piece (I sacrificed a N for two pawns and black has a lot of developement difficulties, specially after...
moves.10... Ke7 11. Bd2: ...this move. Note that if I play c4, the black N has to go to b6, allowing my B to check him in b4. After c5, dxc, the threats is still on.
moves.11... f5: Qg4+ only helps him to exchange some piece and improve his position. So...
moves.12. Ng5: Threatening a nasty check on f7 or e6.
moves.12... Rh6: Defends from both, but I still have a haven for my Q.
moves.13. Qg8: Now, Nc6 just doesn't work because it allows Qxd6+.
moves.13... b6: ? Nf7, Nc6 and we have the exchanges he needs to balance the game.
moves.14. c4: ...Now this N has no place to go to.
moves.14... Bb7 15. cxd5: It allows black to defend d6, thoug. But I recovered my piece and, IF I can save my Q from being trapped, the game is almost won. Bb4 is still a strong threat.
moves.15... Bxd5 16. Bb4+ c5 17. dxc5: Gives him another tempo, but it is also opening the d column for my R.
moves.17... bxc5 18. Bc3: If Ba3, keeping the pressure on c5, Qa5+ would allow him to unravel his position.
moves.18... Nf6: Now he can play this, of course, since d6 is defended, but I still have...
moves.19. Qf7+ Kd6 20. O-O-O: ...and now d6 is threatened again. Now, if something like Qe7, I can happily exchange my Q and  I'll be fine, though not winning.
moves.20... Ng4: Threatening Nxf2, forking my Rooks. I don't mind: it's time to attack.
moves.21. Bc4: Nxf2, Bxd5, NxRd1, BxRa8+, winning. But I overlooked my free N on g4.
moves.21... Qxg5+ 22. Bd2: Q and R are threatened. Qg6 seems the only way to save the day for black, but even so, it was a tough position for black, who went wrong by playing...
